definition: brave; willing to do dangerous or unusual things; involving danger or taking risks
to divide something into smaller parts; to be divided into smaller parts
the act of dividing a part of something into smaller parts
one of the smaller parts into which a part of something has been divided
an area of land that has been divided up for building houses on
an imaginary line through the centre of an object, around which the object turns
a fixed line against which the positions of points are measured, especially points on a graph
a line that divides a shape into two equal parts
an agreement or alliance between two or more countries that forms the centre for a larger grouping of nations
to succeed in doing or completing something
to give somebody something that they can use, or some work or responsibility
to provide a person for a particular task or position
to send a person to work under the authority of somebody or in a particular group
to say that something has a particular value or function, or happens at a particular time or place
to say that your property or rights now belong to somebody else
a feeling or particular quality that is very easy to notice and seems to surround a person or place
difficult economic conditions created by government policies aimed at cutting public spending
the quality of being simple and plain in appearance
the quality of being strict and serious in appearance or manner
the fact of allowing no pleasures and little to make life comfortable
something that is part of a way of life that allows no pleasures and little to make life comfortable
a small brightly coloured bird that lives in warm countries and that can stay in one place in the air by beating its wings very fast, making a continuous low sound (= a humming sound)
a small bird with a short beak. There are several types of finch.
old and no longer used
very old-fashioned
from a much earlier or ancient period of history
a feeling of being very sad that lasts for a long time and often cannot be explained
related to the feelings, attitudes and behaviour of humans in ancient times that have been passed on to modern humans as a habit or instinct
